data.name: RulesText.Text
data.value:
Here are 10 simple rules to follow when playing Othello:
Starting Player: Wether the Player or Computer go first will be decided by random. The starting player will be white.
Turns: Players take turns placing one disc of their color on the board. The disc must be placed on an empty square adjacent to an opponent's disc so there is one or more of the opponent's discs between the new disc and another disc of the player's color.
Flipping Discs: When a player places a disc, any opponent's discs that are enclosed in a straight line between the newly placed disc and another disc of the player's color are flipped to the player's color.
Legal Moves: A move is legal only if it results in at least one of the opponent's discs being flipped. If a player cannot make a legal move, their turn is forfeited.
Endgame: The game ends when neither player can make a legal move. The player with the most discs of their color on the board wins.
Counting Discs: Both players count the number of their colored discs on the board. The player with the most discs of their color wins. In case of a tie, the game is considered a draw.
Following these simple rules will help you enjoy a challenging and rewarding game of Othello!
